subject: RE: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ... Seems to be the most popular from everywhere I look. I think I m settled on this one. ... PERFECT! This is exactly what I was hoping to find (to save my
messageBody:
> #1 - I prefer to use the parallel testing hierarchy

Seems to be the most popular from everywhere I look. I think
I'm settled on this one.

> #2 - There's some kind of Junit additional package that does all of this
> stuff - Its at http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/
> <http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/> - take a look

PERFECT! This is exactly what I was hoping to find (to save my
having to write it). With LGPL, I *think* I can use it... I'll
check with the author to make sure.

> #3 - Have you looked at Aspect Oriented Programming yet? This might get
> around some of your issues. Check it out at http://aspectj.org/

My influence on this project doesn't extend NEARLY as far as being able
to suggest the use of AOP.

> Finally, there're some other JUNIT best practices articles out there -
> try this one at
> http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-12-2000/jw-1221-junit.html

Fairly introductory, but a nice reference. I think I'll include it
in the materials I hand out when encouraging others to USE unit
testing.

Thanks for a prompt and helpful response!

-- Michael Chermside
